function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"After attempting to add the 'Galaxy S10+' model to the cart, an error occurred due to it being blocked by a cart overlay pop-up that became visible once the first item was added to the cart. The cart overlay displays a close button, and the added item (Galaxy S10 5G) with its price. The cart now indicates it contains 1 item. Other features on the website include the navigation bar, 'Shop Now' button, product listings, and the cart overlay.","explanation":"To further test the 'add to cart' functionality for other products, we need to close the cart overlay first. Then, attempt to add the next product ('Galaxy S10+') to the cart again, checking if the cart updates correctly.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r9:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application is an e-commerce platform focused on selling Samsung mobile phones. The homepage features a navigation bar with links to different product categories (Galaxy, S10, M Series, A Series), a shopping cart icon indicating the number of items, and a 'Shop Now' button under a banner for the Galaxy category. Below the banner, there is a product section showcasing different models of the Galaxy S10, each with an 'add to cart' button, product image, name, and price. Additionally, there is a cart overlay that can be triggered but is initially hidden. The main elements on the page include the navigation links, shopping cart, 'Shop Now' button, product listings for Galaxy S10, and the cart overlay.","new_testing_goal":"Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each product to ensure it updates the cart correctly.","explanation":"Start by adding each of the Galaxy S10 models to the cart one by one and check if the cart updates the number of items correctly. Begin with the 'Galaxy S10 5G' model by clicking its 'add to cart' button.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"1:r4:"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"After adding the 'Galaxy S10 5G' model to the cart, the e-commerce platform's homepage shows that the cart now contains 1 item. The 'add to cart' button for the 'Galaxy S10 5G' has changed to 'in cart', indicating the item has been added. Other Galaxy S10 models ('Galaxy S10+', 'Galaxy S10', 'Galaxy S10e') still have the 'add to cart' button available. The cart overlay, when triggered, shows the 'Galaxy S10 5G' in the cart with its price, and options to remove or adjust the quantity. The footer of the cart overlay shows the total price and buttons for 'clear cart' and 'Checkout'.","explanation":"Continue testing the 'add to cart' functionality by adding the next model, 'Galaxy S10+', to the cart. This will check if the cart correctly updates to display multiple items and if each product addition affects the total cart value accurately.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"2:r4:"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each product to ensure it updates the cart correctly..
Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each product to ensure it updates the cart correctly.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.
Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r6:, :r8:, :ra:, :rb:, :r9:, :rc:, :rd:, :re:, :r7:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
